We've got what you need!

I have worn many hats in my career. I taught composition courses at the local state college and universities, wrote technical documentation for hardware, software, and networks, and I’ve led the design team using content-first strategies. I’ve also written and edited articles for MetroJacksonville.com and its current version, the Jaxson. My focus has always been on the user’s experience, whether that’s the student, the user, or the reader.

For technical projects, I manage my work by maintaining a Kanban board that integrates into the team’s Agile processes. I have certifications in Scaled Agile Frameworks, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the Workplace, and I have a Green Belt in Lean Six Sigma.

Currently I am researching historically Black neighborhoods in the process of revitalization and providing residents with the neighborhood’s historical narrative. These narratives help inform city councils and businesses how to best approach an inclusive revitalization that does not force residents out. I love reading, petting cats, and, as a true geriatric millennial, embroidering flowers.
